page.title: 03MUSEUM OF DARTMOOR LIFE
page.content: The museum was first started by a meeting in 1976 where they discussed different things about the museum and then in 1979 they started a charity to raise money for buying the museum. In 1981 they started work to repair the old buildings which consisted of an old mill, which is the museum itself, an old printers, which is the Tourist Information Office. The museum was opened in 1981 by the charitable trust, which has further ideas for the museum, for example they hope to build a display of crashed world war two aircraft and to convert an old dairy into a Victorian cottage. The museum gives you an idea of the life Okehampton people had in the 19th century. The admission fee is 50p. for adults,40p for OAP's and 30p for children. Matthew Bidmead.
